title: Not Good
text: The good: new clean bathroom, beds, quiet between 11 p.m. - 7 a.m., IHOP across the road, the price (? by san francisco standards), quiet air con/fan unitThe not so good: no in-room coffee maker, smallish room, no desk, phone message light continually flashed, hotel looked shabby, the "lite continental breakfast" was definitely "lite" (coffee and a sweet roll), had to get the tv remote from office.The bad: animal hospital adjacent (dogs barking at 7:30 a.m.), hotel refused to store our bags for 3 hours after we checked out as we had a flight in the late p.m. (never had that happen before), windows and walls were thin (traffic and people noise).The conclusion: you get what you pay for.
